We must be fully engaged in confronting anti-Semitism and all other forms of prejudice and hatred.  This day serves not only to remind us of the millions of innocent individuals murdered by the Nazi regime, but also to remind us of our promise of ‘never again’.

We should look to Dr. King’s legacy of courage and service as we confront our nation’s challenges and strive toward a more perfect union.

Dr. King devoted his life to bringing awareness to society’s problems and working with others to solve them.  He was once quoted as saying “Life’s most persistent and urgent question is ‘What are you doing for others?’”
While we have made great strides since his life was cut tragically short, his message still resonates today as a reminder of how far we’ve come, and how far we still have to go.
Today we celebrate the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Dr. King envisioned a world where all men and women were equal in the eyes of the law and in the eyes of society.
